meanings.definition: The act of improvising or performing without preparation.
meanings.sent1: During the extemporisation, the comedian made up jokes on the spot.
meanings.sent2: Her extemporisation on the piano impressed the audience with her talent.
meanings.sent3: The extemporisation of the magician left everyone in awe of his skills.
meanings.sent4: His extemporisation was like a beautiful dance of words flowing effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The extemporisation of the actor brought life to the character in a unique way.

meanings.definition: The process of speaking or performing without prior planning or rehearsal.
meanings.sent1: The extemporisation of the speaker captivated the audience with its spontaneity.
meanings.sent2: The extemporisation of the singer showcased her raw talent and emotion.
meanings.sent3: The extemporisation of the chef in the kitchen led to a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Her extemporisation on stage was like a burst of creativity in motion.
meanings.sent5: The extemporisation of the poet painted vivid images in the minds of the listeners.
